questions.question: Is the item clean and dry?
questions.subtitle: Dirty items can contaminate recycling

questions.question: Does it have multiple materials or parts?
questions.subtitle: For example lid + cup, straw + cup, plastic + paper

questions.question: Is the textile clean and dry?
questions.subtitle: Textile does not go into blue bin

outcomes.explanation: This looks suitable for normal recycling when clean and dry.
tips: Empty and rinse the item before disposal.
Dry the item to avoid contaminating other recyclables.
Place it in a blue recycling bin.
outcomes.instruction: Clean and dry the item, then use the blue recycling bin.

outcomes.explanation: Food or liquid residue can contaminate the recycling stream.
tips: If possible, rinse and dry the item first.
If it cannot be cleaned, dispose it as general waste.
Do not place dirty items in the blue recycling bin.

outcomes.explanation: Separate mixed parts first, then recycle the suitable parts.
tips: Separate plastic, paper, and metal parts if possible.
Recycle clean single-material parts in the blue bin.
Dispose non-recyclable parts as general waste.

outcomes.explanation: Electronic items require special e-waste collection channels.
tips: Do not place this item in a blue recycling bin.
If safe, remove batteries first.
Bring it to an e-waste collection point.
outcomes.instruction: Use an e-waste collection point for this item.

outcomes.explanation: Lighting items should use dedicated lighting collection bins.
tips: Do not put lighting items in blue bins.
Pack carefully to avoid breakage.
Bring the item to a lighting recycling point.

outcomes.explanation: Textile items should go to textile collection channels, not blue bins.
tips: Keep textile items dry.
Bag them separately.
Send to a textile donation or collection point.

outcomes.explanation: There is not enough confidence to give a strict disposal path.
tips: Use AI Trash Scan for a photo-based result.
If still unsure, avoid contaminating blue bins.
Use general waste as a safe fallback.
outcomes.instruction: If unsure, do not use blue bin. Use AI Trash Scan or general waste fallback.
